tweet: The Korean Ambassador for Peace Medal is an expression of appreciation from the Korean government for U.S. veterans including those who served in UN peacekeeping missions. I’ve worked for years to give #CT farmers a chance to cash in on industrial #Hemp, a highly versatile product. It’s a great encouragement to see that 67 #Connecticut farms have acquired growing licences so far—a clear sign of Hemp's place in our #ag future. https://bit.ly/2SL9pfK

Comprehensive postal reform legislation is needed to help ensure the agency is financially sound and I'm proud to support the #USPS Fairness Act – a step in the right direction in this effort. pic.twitter.com/tlYPEJ5OPx

I’ve always been proud to support @USPS, & today had the chance to meet over 1000 members of the United Postmasters & Managers Association to talk more about our work in Congress to bring the Post Office back to profitability, & into the 21st Century. pic.twitter.com/4NIoovr8wD

American workers & older Americans who have done everything right shouldn’t live in fear that their hard-earned retirement savings will collapse. Last week the House passed the #ButchLewisAct, a bill that takes steps to fix the problem before it’s too late. https://bit.ly/2K7qQDq

Great to have the Eagle back home where she belongs! The Eagle is a staple of the #NewLondon waterfront. The @USCG promised us that the Eagle would return back in 2014, and on Friday night they followed through. Welcome home, Eagle! https://bit.ly/32WjPxR

After beginning 2019 began w/ the longest shutdown in history, I was glad the House took care of business last night to pass a #bipartisan #BudgetDeal that helps avoids another shutdown & keeps us #1 in nat’l security & in the global economy. More here: http://bit.ly/2JU8E16

All people deserve to be treated with dignity, but families & children arriving at our southern border seeking asylum are being denied that basic human respect. Yesterday the House passed #HR3239, a bill to force change in how CBP treats those in custody. https://bit.ly/2YmReOH

The talented interns in my #Norwich, #Enfield & DC offices are major parts of our team. We're grateful for them every day, especially on #NationalInternDay! If you or someone you know is interested in joining my team as an intern, click here for more info: https://bit.ly/2K3ntgN

Everyone with a phone in eastern CT knows that there’s been an uptick in #robocalls in recent months and years. Yesterday, the House passed the #StoppingBadRobocalls Act, to curb the soaring number of these abusive calls dialed each day. More here: http://bit.ly/2JQK2X0

There’s no debate that our elections were attacked & are under attack again. Our top law enforcement & intel officials confirm it, #Mueller underscored it yesterday. The House passed #ElectionSecurity legislation, the @SenMajLeader should stop blocking it. https://bit.ly/2Gu9waF

Yesterday the @JournalInquirer published an editorial calling on the Senate to pass my amendment to secure funding for #crumblingfoundations research. My amendment passed the House in June & w/ Senate passage it heads to the President’s desk for signature https://bit.ly/2Gl3OIf

In light of the @usedgov's history of confusing, misleading & denying potentially eligible borrowers from #PSLF, it’s critical that folks interested in enrolling have a detailed understanding of the process & qualifications. For more info, visit my website: http://bit.ly/2YorMwj

Restoring value to the #MinimumWage is a big step in restoring our #MiddleClass. #CT is already a leader in the #FightFor15, & I was proud to help pass the #RaiseTheWage Act in Congress last week to gradually raise the federal minimum to $15 by 2025. https://bit.ly/2M24HJw

This week the House voted 419-6 to pass my #bipartisan bill to eliminate the #CadillacTax—the 40% excise tax on employer-backed #healthcare plans. It’s been a 10-year effort to scrap the tax,& our vote this week is a win for families in #CT & across the US. https://bit.ly/2XSqoCF

Yesterday we bid farewell to Theodore “Ted” Plamondon, a World War II veteran from #Enfield who passed away at age 93. Ted was a true public servant, & a relentless advocate for #veterans, I’m grateful for all of his lasting contributions to eastern #CT. https://bit.ly/2Y7kkFY

The House is getting ready to pass the #RaiseTheWage Act to gradually & incrementally raise the #MinimumWage to $15 by 2025 and give up to 33 MILLION Americans a raise, including over 94,000 right here in eastern #CT. #Fightfor15 pic.twitter.com/vcj5lQ3QOM

This tax has never generated a penny of revenue, yet it continues to threaten working Americans’ health benefits. The House did the right thing today for families across America. @SenMajLdr, the ball is now in your court. pic.twitter.com/cihzepK1R0

181 million Americans get #healthcare through their employer—if the #CadillacTax takes effect, their costs will skyrocket. My bill to repeal the 40% tax has support across the spectrum, 369 #bipartisan cosponsors & from staunch #ACA supporters like @FamiliesUSA& @AmericanCancer.

Today, I was joined by 418 of my colleagues in the House in voting on the passage of my #bipartisan bill to repeal the 40% excise tax on employer-sponsored healthcare plans, the Middle Class Health Benefits Tax Repeal Act #HR748 pic.twitter.com/dhaitesmHs

I’m proud of the work we’ve done together to bring us to this point, and of the bipartisan support we’ve won for our effort. With 369 #bipartisan co-sponsors & counting, we’re ready to repeal the #CadillacTax today in the House. pic.twitter.com/yw8pNlrBYL

Following 10 years of work, the House is finally about to vote on #HR748, my bill to repeal the #CadillacTax once and for all. 181 million Americans receive #healthcare through their employer, and a 40% tax on their plans would cause the cost of their care to skyrocket. pic.twitter.com/LomFMmgYd3

Last week the House passed a bill to permanently authorize federal funds to compensate 9/11 #FirstResponders who fell sick as a result of their heroism at Ground Zero. I encourage the @SenateMajLeader to follow our lead & pass the bill - it's long past due https://nyti.ms/2XJiL1y
